3. Refund  
The process may take up to two (2) months from the date of request.

2. Travel Fund  
Store the amount in a virtual CEB wallet valid for two (2) years and use this to either book a new flight or pay for add-ons (e.g. baggage allowance, seat selection, etc.)

1. Rebook 
Rebook for travel within 60 days at no additional cost, following CEB’s permanent removal of change fees. Fare difference waived.

Cebu Pacific Advisory #6 
Additional Flight Cancellations and flexible options due to Typhoon Odette (Rai)  
As of 11:30PM, December 16, 2021  

Due to Typhoon Odette (Rai), Cebu Pacific and Cebgo has canceled the following flights tomorrow, December 17, 2021: https://t.co/L2XLH8Vul7
For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the chatbot on the Cebu Pacific website.

Passengers are advised to refer to the full list of affected flights here: https://t.co/f0i7ZOjlKY 

The safety of our passengers and crew remains our topmost priority.
They may conveniently cancel up to two (2) hours before their scheduled time of departure and select their preferred option through the Manage Booking portal on the CEB website.

Other domestic flights will still operate as scheduled, however CEB is also offering flexible options (rebook or travel fund) to passengers on select flights who wish to voluntarily postpone their trips on December 17, 2021.

Passengers who wish to rebook to above flights may conveniently do so through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WoEUdR). They may also opt to select travel fund or refund via the same link.

· 5J 331 / 5J 332 Manila – Kalibo – Manila

data.text: Passengers are advised to update their contact details via https://t.co/NZi62XeGfJ to receive email notifications on flight reminders and updates.
4.Pre-register for the RT-PCR test upon arrival.

3.Returning overseas Filipinos (ROFs) or non-OFWs and foreign nationals should book for their own quarantine hotel and pay for RT-PCR test. They may book at hotels in Davao that were designated by the Bureau of Quarantine here
2.Register for Safe Davao QR and save or print the QR code.
This must be presented upon check-in for the flight, and upon arrival in the Philippines.

5J 09 from Dubai to Davao 
1.Passengers must register for One Health Pass through the website:  https://t.co/4RNNoCORxo  before departing Dubai. Upon completion, each passenger will be issued a personal QR code.

3. Returning overseas Filipinos (ROFs) or non-OFWs, and foreign nationals must book at Bureau of Quarantine (BOQ) accredited hotels here . RT PCR tests on the first and fifth or seventh day will be covered by the Department of Health – Cebu.
2. All are subject to swab tests upon arrival at Mactan Cebu International Airport.

Travelers need to take note of the barcode / Travel Reference Number (TRN) sent to their email address upon completion of the form as this is required for validation. In addition, a Health Declaration Form will be distributed inflight, for submission upon arrival.

5J 05 from Dubai to Cebu  
1. Guests on this flight are reminded to complete the arrival form https://t.co/XTjXqogq4g not earlier than five (5) days prior to departure date. This is also pre-registration for all RT-PCR tests to be done upon arrival.

This will be required for their free return flight to Manila. OFWs and their qualified dependents are not required to fill out this form, as the flight to Manila will be handled by government agencies.

Non-OFWs and non-Filipinos who were originally booked on a Dubai-Manila flight must fill out the Cebu Pacific Information Sheet emailed to them, and save a screenshot of the submission confirmation at the end of the form.
Cebu Pacific flights from Dubai to Manila via Cebu and Davao will be provided with free flights to Manila after required safety protocols in Cebu or Davao.

• Foreign nationals vaccinated abroad 
• WHO-issued ICV, or  
• National digital certificate of the foreign government which has accepted VaxCertPH under a reciprocal arrangement
 National digital certificate of the foreign government where they were vaccinated, whichever is available

Non-OFWs vaccinated in the country or abroad, and 
Foreigners vaccinated in the Philippines  
VaxCertPH digital vaccination certificate or 
Bureau of Quarantine/World Health Organization-issued International Certificate of Vaccination or Prophylaxis (ICV), or

*for the purposes of verification, the following will be accepted as proof of vaccination 
•Overseas Filipino Workers (OFWs) and their spouse, parent/s, and/or children traveling with them vaccinated in the Philippines or abroad,
Please book from Bureau of Quarantine (BOQ)- accredited hotels only, and present the booking confirmation upon check-in.

data.text: oFilipino Citizens (OFWs and non-OFWs) - Negative RT-PCR test result, conducted within seventy-two (72) hours before departure or facility-based quarantine upon arrival, until the release of a negative RT-PCR test, conducted during quarantine.

•For fully vaccinated individuals 
oForeign Nationals - Negative RT-PCR test result, conducted within seventy-two (72) hours before departure
oConfirmed booking at a Bureau of Quarantine (BOQ)- quarantine hotel/facility for at least six (6) nights (for non-OFWs and foreign nationals only).
